channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Koch Political Operation Spent Nearly $550 Million During 2024 Cycle
item.description: The huge sum shows that while the Koch network may not hold significant power at high levels of the Republican Party, it remains a financial juggernau...

item.title: One of the few revelations in the Epstein files is a copy of the earliest known red flag about the sex offender: a report taken by the FBI in 1996
item.description: A woman in 1996 believed photos and negatives she had taken of her 12-year-old and 16-year-old sisters for a personal art project had been stolen by E...

item.title: How Democrats Used One Word to Turn the Tide Against Trump
item.description: Both parties are now preparing for “affordability” to play a major role in the midterm elections next year. How did it emerge so quickly?

item.title: Nuno Loureiro, Slain MIT Professor, Was a ‘Brilliant Scientist’
item.description: Nuno Loureiro, 47, was killed by an old classmate who was on the run from a shooting at Brown University, the authorities said.

item.title: Meet the Gen Xer who lives on a boat—she supercommutes to California every few weeks for her $100-an-hour job. Just eight shifts cover all her bills
item.description: Josie Lauducci, a Bay Area nurse, has spent a decade living aboard a sailboat with her family, flying in for her shifts as part of a growing supercomm...

item.title: Trump Administration Pushes Asylum Seekers to Apply in Other Countries
item.description: In immigration courts, U.S. lawyers have filed thousands of requests to dismiss asylum cases and force people to pursue asylum elsewhere.

item.title: Why Middle-Class Americans Say Life Is Unaffordable
item.description: Economists say that a typical middle-class family today is richer than one in the 1960s. Americans in their 20s and 30s don’t believe it.

item.title: Congressmen who pushed to release Epstein files say massive blackout doesn’t comply with law and ‘are exploring all options’ — including impeachment
item.description: The Justice Department’s extensive redactions to the Jeffrey Epstein files on Friday don’t comply with the law that Congress passed last month mandati...

item.title: A Woman Froze to Death on an Alpine Trek. Is Her Boyfriend to Blame?
item.description: A man in Austria was charged in the death of his girlfriend after leaving her behind, in a case testing ideas of freedom and responsibility in the mou...

item.title: U.S. and Venezuela Jam Caribbean GPS Signals to Thwart Attacks, Raising Flight Hazard
item.description: Military brinkmanship between President Trump and Nicolás Maduro of Venezuela has led to an increase in electronic warfare in the region.

item.title: What Fans Did to Attend a Bad Bunny Show in Mexico City
item.description: The award-winning Puerto Rican artist, the most-streamed on the planet, is performing eight concerts in Mexico. People flocked from all over the world...

item.title: Best of 2025, Canada Edition
item.description: Here are the Canadian standouts from The Times’s culture, books and arts coverage over the last year.

item.title: With Attacks on Oil Tankers, Ukraine Takes Aim at Russia’s War Financing
item.description: Strikes on four vessels signal that Kyiv is willing to expand the maritime theater of the conflict in an effort to crimp Moscow’s military funding.

item.title: Epstein files land with a thud as documents are heavily redacted, including contact info for Trump, celebrities, and bankers
item.description: “Simply releasing a mountain of blacked out pages violates the spirit of transparency and the letter of the law,” Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer...

item.title: Epstein files: Trump, Clinton, Summers, Gates not returning any results in search bar
